chicken.Name: Chicken with Mustard and Porcini Mushrooms
chicken.Instructions:
I started by cutting the mushrooms (porcini) into large pieces so that their flavor would stand out. I heated a non-stick pan with sunflower oil and added the mushrooms. I cooked them until they turned golden brown. Meanwhile, I sliced the red onion and chicken breast into strips.

Once the mushrooms were golden, I added the onion and chicken to the pan. I sautéed them for about 6 minutes before adding the cream, water, mustard, and minced garlic. I let everything simmer over medium-low heat for about 15 minutes until the sauce thickened. I seasoned with salt and pepper to taste. 

I served this seasonal dish with toasted bread and sprinkled some rosemary on top.

chicken.Name: Roast Chicken with Herbs and Garlic
chicken.Instructions:
I prepared a dry rub with paprika, fresh ground pepper, dried herbs (rosemary, thyme, oregano, basil), garlic, and lemon zest. I rubbed the mixture over the chicken, inside and out, and let it marinate overnight. An hour before cooking, I took it out of the fridge to bring it to room temperature.

I stuffed the chicken with lemon slices, fresh herbs (basil, tarragon, parsley), and salt, then roasted it at 180°C for about an hour. In the last 10 minutes, I used the oven's ventilation function to create a crisp, golden crust.

For the creamy mashed potatoes, I boiled the potatoes in salted water until tender, drained them, and mashed them with hot milk and butter. The texture was silky and airy.

I served the chicken whole, allowing everyone to pick their favorite pieces, alongside the mashed potatoes and cherry compote. It was a nostalgic, heartwarming family meal.

chicken.Name: Teriyaki Chicken with Roasted Potatoes
chicken.Instructions:
I preheated the oven to 180°C and prepared a large baking tray with parchment paper.

For the chicken, I singed off any remaining feathers and placed it in the roasting dish. I stuffed it with orange and lemon slices and parsley, then rubbed the exterior with teriyaki sauce, chili sauce, salt, pepper, and ground ginger.

I added some water to the dish and roasted the chicken.

For the potatoes, I roasted them, peeled them, cut them in half, and topped them with butter, salt, pepper, garlic, and chopped fresh parsley. I also roasted two red onions alongside them for extra flavor.

The meal was simple and delicious.

chicken.Name: Chicken with Lime and Peanut Sauce
chicken.Instructions:
Step 1: I lightly scored the chicken breast with a knife and seasoned it generously with salt and pepper. I then drizzled olive oil directly on the chicken.

Step 2: I placed the chicken in a pan and grated lime zest over it, cooking each side for 4 minutes. After cooking, I set the chicken aside.

Step 3: I chopped a chili pepper and garlic, sautéed them in the pan, and added the chicken back in along with peanut butter and cream. I baked everything in a preheated oven at low heat for 25 minutes.

Step 4: I served the chicken with lime zest and chili slices on top. It was so flavorful that no garnish was needed, but it pairs well with saffron rice, sautéed vegetables, or a fresh salad.

chicken.Name: Italian Chicken with Spring Salad
chicken.Instructions:
Step 1: I preheated the oven to 180°C. While the oven heated, I prepared the chicken by trimming off the fat, seasoning it with salt and pepper, and cutting pockets into each breast.

Step 2: I stuffed the pockets with diced mozzarella, basil, and sundried tomatoes. I secured the chicken with toothpicks, sprinkled it with chili flakes, drizzled some of the oil from the sundried tomatoes, and baked it for 25-30 minutes.

Step 3: While the chicken cooked, I prepared a colorful spring salad with fresh ramsons, spinach, radishes, and sesame seeds, dressed with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.

Step 4: After baking, I served the chicken alongside the vibrant salad.
